issue.title: Gazebo fails to start when compiled with visibility=hidden

content.raw:
A simpler test:
~~~
$ gzserver --verbose
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 3.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2013 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.188
~~~
and in a separate terminal:
~~~
$ gztopic list
/gazebo/default/request
~~~
It only shows one topic, when there should be a bunch. Transport is not my strong suit, so I don't know if I have much more help to offer.
content.html:
A simpler test:

$ gzserver --verbose
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 3.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2013 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.188

and in a separate terminal:

$ gztopic list
/gazebo/default/request

It only shows one topic, when there should be a bunch. Transport is not my strong suit, so I don't know if I have much more help to offer.
